location.address: Paithalmala Hill Station, Kappimala, Kannur District, Kerala, India

images.caption: Grasslands and misty hills of Paithalmala

history.short_description: A beautiful hill station in Kannur with rolling meadows, fog-covered peaks, and one of the most scenic trekking routes in North Kerala.
history.detailed: Paithalmala, also known as Pythalmala, is a part of the Western Ghats and lies at an altitude of around 1,370 meters. Historically, the region was used by local tribes for grazing and as a pathway to Kodagu. Over time, it evolved into a popular trekking and nature tourism destination due to its vast grasslands, seasonal flowers, and panoramic valley views. The old Paithalmala watchtower offers spectacular views of the entire Western Ghat ranges and is a key attraction.

significance.nature: Expansive meadows, misty high-altitude climate, and lush mountain ecosystems.
significance.trekking: One of Kannur's most famous trekking destinations.
significance.tourism: Popular among photographers, nature lovers, and adventure hikers.

timings.note: Avoid entering after sunset due to forest area restrictions.

warnings: Steep and slippery trails during monsoon

best_time_to_visit: June to August for misty monsoon views

common_complaints: Trek can be tiring for beginners
tips_from_visitors: Start early morning for misty views.
Wear trekking shoes and carry water.
Carry salt or spray to avoid leeches during rainy season.

by_road.description: From Taliparamba → Kappimala village → Paithalmala trekking base.
by_road.parking_info: Parking available near trekking start point.

local_transport_tips: Road becomes narrow and hilly near the peak.
Carry essentials as there are no shops near the top.
